comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: I think that is an "H" on the negative, and this is Henry Irslinger on the left, an Austrian best known as a champion wrestler. www.onlineworldofwrestling.com/profiles/h/henry-irslinger... However in 1914 he was managing Tom McCarty. In a newspaper article from November, 1914, McCarty is mentioned as "the newest White hope", referring to the effort to find a white boxer to unseat Black boxer Jack Johnson, who had won the heavyweight championship in 1908. news.google.com/newspapers?id=PPxbAAAAIBAJ&sjid=mlQNA...

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks for providing the links artolog. It appears that Henry Irslinger was managing Tommy McCarty in 1914.  We'll make the change to the caption and add the date to the record the next time we update.
